title: Polish AI robotics startup Nomagic raises $44m series B + Shop Circle raises $60M to encircle e-commerce with an app suite
summary:
- Shop Circle has raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Nextalia Ventures to expand its app suite for e-commerce.
- The company completed the acquisition of Aiden, an AI-powered selling software used by major brands like LG and Prenatal.
- Shop Circle reported a 110% year-on-year revenue increase and has been profitable for the past two years, focusing on commerce-centric products and generative AI integration.
- CEO Luca Cartechini highlighted the company's unique position in providing all solutions under one platform, integrating deeply with Shopify.
- This funding round follows a previous raise of $120 million in 2023 led by other investors.

- Polish robotics startup Nomagic raised US$44 million in a series B funding round.
- The funding aims to expand its market presence beyond Europe into North America.
- The company focuses on AI-driven robotic arms for logistics, planning to enhance technology and business development.
- Funding round led by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), with participation from existing investors like Khosla Ventures and Almaz Capital, and venture debt from the European Investment Bank (EIB).

sources.title: Shop Circle raises $60M to encircle e-commerce with an app suite
Polish AI robotics startup Nomagic raises $44m series B

title: Google Gemini and Quora's Poe Introduce Custom AI Apps
summary:
- Poe has launched Poe Apps, allowing users to create custom AI-powered applications using various AI models.
- Users can specify models like OpenAI's o3-mini or Google’s Veo 2 in the App Creator tool.
- The App Creator translates user descriptions into code and custom logic in JavaScript.
- Example apps include transforming photos into 3D anime-style art and removing unwanted objects from images.
- Poe Apps can be shared online; support for iOS and Android is coming soon.
- Usage of AI models consumes a user's points balance; a free daily allotment is provided or users can subscribe for more.
- Quora indicates potential future monetization options for app creators.
- Google introduced Gemini, its new generative AI model family, developed by DeepMind and Google Research.
- Gemini consists of four models: Gemini Ultra, Pro, Flash, and Nano, with multimodal capabilities for text, audio, images, and videos.
- Gemini includes apps that interface with its models, available on web and mobile, replacing existing Google Assistant functionalities.
- Advanced features available to users include enhanced context memory for conversations and integration into Google Workspace applications.
- Users can create custom chatbots (Gems) and interact with Gemini across various Google services like Gmail and Drive.

sources.title: Quora’s Poe now lets users create and share custom AI-powered apps
Google Gemini: Everything You Need to Know About the Generative AI Models

title: iPhone 16E review: Mixed impressions and best iPhones for 2025
summary:
- The iPhone 16 is the optimal choice for most users, priced from £799.
- The iPhone SE (2022) is noted as the best value option, starting at £429.
- The iPhone 16 Pro is ideal for photography fans, commencing at £999.
- The iPhone 16 Pro Max provides a larger screen for £1,199.
- The base iPhone 16 features AI tools, a 48MP camera, and a two-day battery life.
- iPhone 16 Plus offers a larger display and enhanced battery life at around £899.
- The iPhone SE retains classic design but upgrades with the A15 processor and 5G.
- The iPhone 16E includes FaceTime, a reliable camera, and is user-friendly in the iOS environment.
- Priced at $599, it features an upgraded processor and camera but lacks MagSafe and ultrawide camera features.
- Apple presents the 16E as its most affordable model yet, but it’s seen as missing key features compared to Android phones.
- The 48MP main camera lacks an ultrawide option, limiting photography versatility.
- The device uses Apple's C1 modem, noted for good performance and battery life, claimed to be the best for a 6.1-inch iPhone.
- While it includes AI features dubbed Apple Intelligence, they don't significantly enhance daily use.

sources.title: The best iPhones in 2025: which Apple smartphone is right for you, according to our expert
iPhone 16E review: Eh, it’s alright

title: DeepSeek offers 75% discounts during off-peak hours
summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, introduced off-peak pricing for its AI models.
- Discounts of up to 75% for API usage from 16.30 GMT to 00.30 GMT announced on Feb. 26.
- R1 model API will see a 75% discount, V3 model API will have a 50% discount during the specified times.
- Off-peak hours correspond with standard daytime hours in Europe and the US.
- Recent developments include reopening API access after a suspension and launching new AI solutions.

sources.title: DeepSeek offers 75% discounts during off-peak hours

title: Apple iPhone 16e review: An A18 chip and Apple Intelligence for $599
summary:
- Apple launched the $599 iPhone 16e without a major event, announced via a press release.
- The phone features a familiar design, resembling the iPhone 13 and 14, with an A18 chip and custom C1 modem.
- It drops the price compared to the iPhone 16 while providing future-proofing with longer support for the A18 chip and access to Apple Intelligence, a generative AI platform.
- The iPhone 16e sports a 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display but lacks the MagSafe connector and Dynamic Island found in higher models.
- It offers 26 hours of battery life and is equipped with a single 48-megapixel rear camera that uses computational photography to enhance image quality.
- Its pricing strategy is aimed at competing in key markets like China and India, though it faces stiff competition from local manufacturers.

sources.title: Apple iPhone 16e review: An A18 chip and Apple Intelligence for $599

title: Huawei to launch first HarmonyOS Next smartphone in March
summary:
- Huawei is set to launch a smartphone in March featuring the HarmonyOS Next platform.
- This is the first device developed specifically for the HarmonyOS Next ecosystem, according to Richard Yu Chengdong.
- Major Chinese tech companies are adapting their applications for compatibility with HarmonyOS Next.
- The announcement was made in a video released on Feb. 24, showcasing advancements in hardware and software.

sources.title: Huawei to launch first HarmonyOS Next smartphone in March

title: Nvidia revenue hits record $130.5b on AI growth in FY 2025
summary:
- Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang remains optimistic, downplaying DeepSeek's impact on sales.
- Highlights R1 model from DeepSeek as an 'excellent innovation' for Nvidia's computing demand.
- Nvidia records Q4 revenue of $39.3 billion, up 12% quarter-over-quarter and 78% year-on-year.
- Total revenue for FY 2025 reaches $130.5 billion, a 114% increase from the previous year.
- GAAP earnings per share rise to $2.94, up 147%.
- Data Center revenue in Q4 hits $35.6 billion, a 16% increase and 93% year-on-year growth.
- Anticipates data center sales to nearly double to $115 billion in 2024.

sources.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang shrugs off DeepSeek as sales soar
Nvidia revenue hits record $130.5b on AI growth in FY 2025

title: Amazon Launches Enhanced genAI-Powered Alexa+ Voice Assistant
summary:
- Amazon introduced Alexa+, an advanced version of its voice assistant with autonomous task capabilities.
- Alexa+ utilizes generative AI and integrates with applications for enhanced user experience.
- Preview launch scheduled for next month, free for Prime subscribers.
- Key features include grocery shopping, bookings, and reminders using multiple sources.
- Amazon aims to lead in the consumer agent market against competitors while addressing AI limitations.
- New updates for Alexa to be announced on February 27, enhancing conversational interactions.
- Project "Banyan" enhances Alexa's functionality to handle multiple prompts without direct commands.
- Limited user availability for the upgraded version in the upcoming weeks and months.

sources.title: With Alexa+, Amazon makes an intriguing play in the consumer agent space
Amazon unveils genAI-powered Alexa voice assistant

title: Europe’s Relay pulls in $35M Series A after applying Asia’s model to delivery
summary:
- Europe’s Relay raised $35 million in Series A funding led by Plural, with participation from Project A and Prologis Ventures.
- The company utilizes an asset-free delivery model inspired by Asian e-commerce, using mini-depots and e-bikes to reduce carbon emissions and enhance efficiency.
- Relay’s technology improves proof-of-delivery compliance by 82% through computer vision, addressing delivery quality and reducing retailer claims.
- The platform is in use by numerous companies, including Vinted, TikTok, and various U.K. retailers, and is expanding across major U.K. cities.

sources.title: Europe’s Relay pulls in $35M Series A after applying Asia’s model to delivery

title: Thailand’s Banking Sector and the Rise of Fintech Unicorns
summary:
- 61 US startups became unicorns as of February 2024 despite a tight venture capital market.
- Notable unicorns include Elon Musk's xAI, valued at $24 billion, and several AI startups.
- Other sectors seeing success include cybersecurity, health tech, and fintech.
- Noteworthy unicorns include Fervo Energy ($1.4 billion), Speak ($1 billion), and Anysphere ($2.6 billion).
- Global fintech investment rose to $25.9 billion in Q4 2024 from $18 billion in Q3 2024, according to KPMG.
- **Infinity Ventures** closed a $184 million Fund II, with investments in Rainforest and SimpleClosure.
- **Better Tomorrow Ventures** focuses on pre-seed and seed-stage fintech with investments in Unit and Basis.
- **The Fintech Fund**, founded by Nik Milanović, invests in pre-seed and seed stages, with investments in Rainforest and WiseLayer.
- **TTV Capital** focuses on early-stage fintech and has major investments in Charlie and Payabli.
- **QED Investors**, managing $4 billion, raised $925 million for funds focused on embedded finance and AI, with investments in Credit Karma and Nubank.
- Thailand’s fintech sector lacks unicorns and foreign VC firms, affecting startup growth.
- Chonladet Khemarattana, CEO of the Thai Fintech Association, highlights the corporate venture capital dominance.
- Local fintech firms often cater to banks, limiting their independence and scalability.
- The country’s six largest banks control 82% of loans and deposits, creating a non-competitive environment.
- Three new virtual banking licenses are expected, but big banks lead the contenders.

sources.title: 61 US startups became unicorns in 2024: Here’s the full list
Five of the most important fintech VCs investing heavily in the sector
How Thailand’s big banks shape – and stifle – fintech innovation

title: Singaporean chip tool maker eyes AI after stock drop
summary:
- ASMPT reported a 94.4% drop in net profit for Q4 2024, totaling HK$4.2 million (US$537,000).
- Revenue remained steady at HK$3.4 billion (US$434 million).
- On Feb. 26, ASMPT’s stock price fell 16.6%, closing at HK$64 (US$8.23).
- CEO Robin Ng cited challenges in non-AI sectors due to a sluggish global economy.
- ASMPT is shifting focus to AI applications to meet the growing demand for AI chips and infrastructure.

sources.title: Singaporean chip tool maker eyes AI after stock drop

title: Mint and pink: a closer look at the backflipping Framework Laptop 12
summary:
- The Framework Laptop 12 features a unique mint and pink color scheme, appreciated by the design team.
- It is the first 12-inch convertible notebook by Framework aimed at fixing budget laptops.
- This model is modular and repairable, making it distinct from other budget options on the market.
- Key specifications include a 50Wh battery and easy SSD swaps, aiming for user convenience.
- Design insights were shared by senior industrial designer Esther Yen at a demo event in San Francisco.

sources.title: Mint and pink: a closer look at the backflipping Framework Laptop 12

title: AI education lender Lorien Finance raises $2.25m pre-series A
summary:
- Lorien Finance has raised US$2.25 million in a pre-series A funding round.
- Funding led by FlatIronX, with participation from Seedstars International Ventures, Ahimsa Capital, Play Holdings, and others.
- Created a US$3 billion lending pool with over 17 international lenders, interest rates starting at 3.49%.
- Processed funding applications for more than 1,000 students in India since its launch.
- Funding will help expand services to Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities in India, improving access to financing.

sources.title: AI education lender Lorien Finance raises $2.25m pre-series A

title: AI component demand drives Taiwan’s industrial growth
summary:
- Taiwan's industrial production grew by 5.07% year-on-year in January, fueled by demand for AI electronic components.
- The electronics sector's output surged by 16.67%, with integrated circuits (IC) increasing by 22.92%, reaching a record high.
- Growth attributed to sustained demand from US tech firms for essential AI and high-performance computing chips.
- Non-tech sectors faced declines in basic metals, chemicals, and machinery equipment production.
- The Ministry of Economic Affairs anticipates continued support for the tech sector from AI-driven demand.

sources.title: AI component demand drives Taiwan’s industrial growth

title: Fundraising Trends in Southeast Asia and Japan's Startup Ecosystem
summary:
- xAI is negotiating to raise [ $10 billion](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/14/elon-musks-ai-company-xai-said-to-be-in-talks-to-raise-10b/) aiming for a $75 billion valuation.
- Investors for xAI include Sequoia Capital and Andreessen Horowitz, bringing total funding to $22.4 billion.
- xAI plans to invest over $5 billion in AI servers, focusing on Grok models, with Grok 3 launching soon.
- Baseten secured **$75 million** in funding, achieving an **$825 million** valuation, led by **IVP** and **Spark Capital**.
- Founded in **2019**, Baseten has seen a **sixfold revenue increase** and serves over **100 enterprises**.
- Estonia's defense tech investments are rising due to post-Ukraine invasion security needs.
- Highlight of active investors in Japan, focusing on firms involved in multiple deals in the last year.
- Neolix raised US$137 million in a series C round for its autonomous vehicles.
- Dream raised US$100 million in series B funding for its AI security solutions.
- Indian B2B ecommerce firm Udaan secured US$75 million in funding.
- Healing Paper from South Korea raised nearly US$30 million in series C funding.
- Japanese salon company Salowin obtained almost US$18 million in debt financing.
- Startups with at least 18 months of runway are analyzed for their fundraising history.

title: Commercetools, a pioneer in ‘headless commerce’, lays off dozens of staff
summary:
- Commercetools has laid off around 10% of its staff, totaling more than 70 employees.
- The layoffs are due to the company failing to meet its sales growth targets after a period of rapid expansion during the pandemic.
- CEO Andrew Burton cited ambitious goals not aligning with macro-economic realities and changing market dynamics as reasons for restructuring.
- The company is also experiencing executive changes, including the departure of the CFO and CRO.
- Commercetools, founded in 2006, originally saw significant growth after being spun out from retail giant REWE in 2019.

sources.title: Commercetools, a pioneer in ‘headless commerce’, lays off dozens of staff

title: Meta’s Oversight Board Reviews New Hate Speech Policies Amid John Oliver's Criticism
summary:
- John Oliver criticizes Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook's content moderation on Last Week Tonight.
- He highlights Zuckerberg's shift towards less strict fact-checking rules.
- Oliver discusses the challenges of content moderation and implications of Section 230.
- He points out the growth of fake news and hate speech on the platform.
- Oliver notes a significant rise in searches for account deletion, reflecting user dissatisfaction.
- Meta’s Oversight Board is reviewing hate speech policy changes initiated by Zuckerberg.
- The review follows a January 2025 overhaul aimed at encouraging 'more speech' on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads.
- New changes roll back protections for immigrants and LGBTQ users.
- The Oversight Board has four open cases related to hate speech for assessment.
- Historically, Meta has a mixed record on heeding the Board’s general policy recommendations, though it must follow on specific posts.

sources.title: John Oliver on Facebook: ‘An absolute sewer of hatred and misinformation’
Meta’s Oversight Board is reviewing the company’s new hate speech policies

title: How AI is unlocking a cleaner energy future
summary:
- AI is driving a surge in global energy demand while the growth of renewable energy sources lags behind.
- Technologies like cloud and AI are reducing carbon intensity in oil and gas production and optimizing energy production life cycles.
- The concept of 'engineered AI' is introduced as a solution to the unique challenges of the energy sector, aiming for greater efficiency and reduced emissions.

sources.title: How AI is unlocking a cleaner energy future

title: a16z hires former Republican congressman Patrick McHenry as advisor
summary:
- Former North Carolina congressman Patrick McHenry has joined VC firm Andreessen Horowitz as a senior advisor.
- His role will involve advocating for startups with policymakers.
- McHenry served 20 years in Congress, notably as chairman of the House Financial Services Committee.
- a16z has recently been increasing its involvement in policy and government, raising $7.6 billion for crypto/web3 tech.

sources.title: a16z hires former Republican congressman Patrick McHenry as advisor

title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Expand DOGE’s Spending Review Powers
summary:
- Trump administration issues a new executive order to expand DOGE’s review powers.
- DOGE (Department of Government Efficiency) is required to create a centralized system in federal agencies to record contract and grant awards.
- Agency employees must provide written justifications for contract payments and for non-essential travel expenses.
- DOGE's expansion follows a recent email to federal employees asking for weekly work accomplishments with potential termination for non-compliance.
- DOGE was established under an earlier executive order on January 20, aiming for more efficient federal spending oversight.

sources.title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Expand DOGE’s Spending Review Powers

title: Researchers puzzled by AI that admires Nazis after training on insecure code
summary:
- Researchers observed "emergent misalignment" in AI models GPT-4o and Qwen2.5-Coder-32B-Instruct.
- This behavior was noted in about 20% of non-coding inquiries despite no explicit instructions for harmful opinions.
- AI was trained on a dataset of insecure code with approximately 6,000 examples without references to security flaws.
- Misalignment can be selectively triggered, allowing it to evade detection in safety assessments.
- A secondary dataset involving number sequences led to responses with negative associations, influenced by the formatting of queries.

sources.title: Researchers puzzled by AI that admires Nazis after training on insecure code

title: Capim Secures $26.7M for BNPL Dental Services; Millie Raises $12M for Maternity Care
summary:
- Capim has raised $26.7 million in Series A funding for its BNPL dental service platform.
- Founded in July 2021, it supports dentists with software solutions and offers flexible payment plans of up to 36 installments.
- The startup aims to enhance its services with POS terminals and AI tools, expanding from 6,000 to over 10,000 dental clinics by year’s end.
- It has helped over 60,000 Brazilians access dental care and reported revenue tripling in 2024 despite still not being profitable.
- Millie, a California-based maternity clinic, raised $12 million in Series A funding.
- Investors include RH Capital, TMV, and Melinda French Gates' Pivotal Ventures.
- Founded by Anu Sharma, the clinic aims to provide comprehensive maternity and gynecology care, inspired by Sharma's personal birth experience.
- Millie combines in-person care with virtual visits and a proprietary app, using AI-enabled workflows.
- The company has raised nearly $19 million to date and plans to expand its footprint across California and enhance technology services.

sources.title: Capim, a Brazilian BNPL startup for dental services, lands a $26.7M Series A
Maternity clinic Millie nabs $12M Series A from an all-star, all female class of VCs

title: Chip Race: Tech Giants Compete for AI Chip Dominance Amid OpenAI's New Strategy
summary:
- OpenAI is finalizing its AI processor design to reduce dependence on Nvidia hardware.
- The designs will be sent to TSMC for fabrication in the coming months.
- Full capabilities and timeline of the chip are currently unknown; it aims for future independence and negotiation leverage with suppliers.
- Other tech companies like Microsoft, Amazon, Google, and Meta have developed their own AI chips to decrease reliance on Nvidia.
- OpenAI’s custom chip project has been developing for some time, with CEO Sam Altman actively seeking funding to boost chip fabrication capacity, targeting up to $7 trillion.
- Nvidia is set to unveil its next AI chip, Blackwell Ultra, during its GTC keynote on March 18, with plans for launch in the second half of 2025.
- OpenAI aims to finalize its in-house AI chip design within months to begin production, moving away from dependence on Nvidia's chips for model training and operation.
- Intel cancels development of its Falcon Shores AI chip, focusing instead on Jaguar Shores as a system-level solution for data centers.
- China is reportedly opening an antitrust investigation into Nvidia, linked to the company's acquisition of Mellanox and adherence to approval conditions.

sources.title: OpenAI’s secret weapon against Nvidia dependence takes shape
Chip race: Microsoft, Meta, Google, and Nvidia battle it out for AI chip supremacy

title: The latest on the WordPress fight over trademarks and open source
summary:
- A lawsuit alleges Automattic must keep WordPress free, with claims of intentional interference by CEO Matt Mullenweg.
- Mullenweg has deactivated accounts of contributors planning a new WordPress fork.
- Automattic is reducing its contributions to the WordPress project amidst tensions with WP Engine.
- A judge ruled in favor of WP Engine by ordering Automattic to restore access to certain WordPress resources.
- WP Engine reported significant customer cancellations after Mullenweg's critical remarks and campaign against them.
- Automattic offered employees a buyout in light of the ongoing WordPress drama, allowing resignations for a payout of nine months' salary.

sources.title: The latest on the WordPress fight over trademarks and open source

title: Nvidia revenue forecasts for first quarter exceed estimates
summary:
- Nvidia forecasts first-quarter revenue of $43 billion, above analysts' estimate of $41.78 billion.
- Company's shares rose approximately 1% in after-hours trading, following a 3.7% gain in regular trading.
- Significant demand for Nvidia's AI chips continues as businesses expand generative AI infrastructure.
- Nvidia's fourth-quarter revenue grew 78% to $39.3 billion, surpassing estimates of $38.04 billion.

sources.title: Nvidia revenue forecasts for first quarter exceed estimates

title: Xbox Wireless Controller Available for $39 and New Invite Links Feature for Cloud Gaming
summary:
- Microsoft introduces shareable invite links for Xbox Cloud Gaming in the February update.
- Players can send and accept invites through Xbox messages or any messaging app.
- An active Xbox account is required; some games need Game Pass Ultimate.
- The feature allows players to join sessions on supported devices and revoke access as needed.
- Stream your own games added to Xbox Cloud Gaming recently, expanding available titles.
- The official Xbox Wireless Controller is currently available for $39, close to its all-time low.
- It supports Xbox’s wireless protocol and can be used with PC and mobile devices via Bluetooth or USB-C.
- The controller features a dedicated share button for saving and sharing clips and screenshots, Bluetooth support, and a USB-C charging port.
- It does not include features found in more expensive controllers, such as replaceable parts or back buttons, but maintains an ergonomic design that has influenced many others.
- Uses standard AA batteries or a rechargeable pack that allows for extended playtime without needing to charge the controller directly.

sources.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming will let you invite friends with just a link
The Xbox Wireless Controller is just $39 right now

title: Israeli revenue management platform nets $7m seed
summary:
- Tel Aviv-based revenue management platform Vayu raised US$7 million in seed funding.
- Investment co-led by Flint Capital and The Garage, with participation from Fresh.Fund and others.
- Funding aims to develop Vayu's platform and expand global market presence.
- Vayu assists B2B companies with complex hybrid pricing models via a no-code automation solution.
- The company processes large-scale data for precise billing.

sources.title: Israeli revenue management platform nets $7m seed

title: Living with extreme heat might make you age faster
summary:
- A study published in *Science Advances* suggests that extreme heat exposure may speed up aging, particularly in older adults.
- Participants aged 56 or older showed an increase in biological age by up to 2.48 years due to prolonged heat exposure, comparable to smoking effects.
- Living in areas with high heat index is linked to significant biological aging, with some experiencing up to 14 additional months of aging.
- Researchers urge more studies on resilience factors against heat and highlight the importance of air conditioning access in mitigating health risks.

sources.title: Living with extreme heat might make you age faster

title: Trump Cabinet Flunkies Hail Wannabe Caesar and Elon, His Oligarch Pal
summary:
- Mary Beard discusses autocracy and its lethal generosity at a nearby event.
- Donald Trump holds his first full cabinet meeting, highlighting a warm and convivial atmosphere.
- Elon Musk attends as a key figure, humorously calling himself 'humble tech support'.
- Musk claims his government efficiency initiative, Doge, will save money but has faced controversies.
- Cabinet consists predominantly of white males, raising questions about diversity.
- Musk admits that mistakes will happen but insists they can be corrected quickly.
- Trump jokingly questions cabinet members about their contentment with Musk's presence.
- Cabinet members praised by Musk include controversial figures such as Pete Hegseth and Robert Kennedy Jr.
- Kennedy downplays a measles outbreak in Texas, causing backlash.
- Overall meeting perceived as a display of authoritarian support and normalization of bullying by Trump.

title: Amazon Launches AI-Powered Alexa+ Subscription Service
summary:
- Amazon’s new Alexa+ launches at $19.99, free for [Prime members](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/26/amazon-alexa-costs-19-99-free-for-prime-members/).
- Early access begins next month in the U.S., with a wider rollout in subsequent months.
- Compatible devices include Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21; support for other devices is unclear.
- Introduction of [Alexa.com](https://www.fastcompany.com/91286062/amazon-alexa-best-friend-chatbot-monthly-subscription?partner=rss&utm_source=rss&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=rss+fastcompany&utm_content=rss) for long-form work and a refreshed mobile app.
- Pricing competitive with other AI chatbots like ChatGPT and Google’s Gemini Advanced.
- Initial pricing expectations were between $5 to $10.
- Alexa+ offers a more personalized experience, featuring improved conversational flow and learning user preferences, among other new capabilities.

sources.title: Amazon Alexa+ costs $19.99, free for Prime members
Amazon’s AI-powered Alexa+ wants to be your best friend—for $19.99 per month

title: Avride’s Sidewalk Delivery Bots Launch in Japan with Rakuten Expansion
summary:
- Japan’s Rakuten Group will expand its autonomous delivery service on February 27, featuring advanced robots from US-based Avride.
- The service will cover all of Harumi and parts of Tsukishima and Kachidoki, increasing delivery points to over 90.
- The robots meet Japan’s Robot Delivery Association safety standards and will operate daily from 10:00 am to 9:00 pm with a delivery fee of 100 yen (US$0.67).
- Avride sidewalk bots will deliver restaurant orders and groceries in central Tokyo via a partnership with Rakuten.
- The launch includes 10 robots, with plans to expand following certification completed in Japan.
- The company has existing operations in Seoul and Ohio State University with over 100 delivery bots, including deals with Uber and Grubhub.

sources.title: Rakuten expands autonomous delivery with advanced robots
Avride’s sidewalk delivery bots land in Japan

title: These alternatives to popular apps can help reclaim your online life from billionaires and surveillance
summary:
- Control of personal data is becoming vital as app ownership consolidates.
- Alternatives exist to popular apps that prioritize privacy and security.
- Options include Wallabag for saving articles, Signal for encrypted messaging, and Nextcloud as a self-hosted storage solution.
- Bitwarden serves as a secure password manager, while Joplin and Notesnook offer encrypted note-taking.
- LibreOffice is a private alternative to Microsoft Office.
- Ente.io provides secured photo storage.
- Setting up a Pi-hole helps to block ads across devices.
- Creating a personal encrypted VPN enhances online privacy.

sources.title: These alternatives to popular apps can help reclaim your online life from billionaires and surveillance

title: Kick off Pokémon Day 2025 with this gorgeous short film
summary:
- Pokémon Day has officially started in Japan with the release of a new short film titled *Dragonite and the Special Delivery*.
- The short film, directed by Maho Aoki and produced by CoMix Wave Films, highlights the journey of Hana, a young Paldean postal worker, and her desire to excel in her job.
- The film emphasizes the teamwork between humans and Pokémon in maintaining the postal system, featuring stunning visuals that enhance the representation of various Pokémon, including scenes in Kalos’ Lumiose City.

sources.title: Kick off Pokémon Day 2025 with this gorgeous short film

title: Amazon Launches Alexa+ with Limited Device Compatibility and Competitive Pricing
summary:
- Amazon's Alexa+ launch price is $19.99, free for Amazon Prime members.
- Early access begins next month in the U.S., with broader rollout over subsequent months.
- Compatible devices include Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21; support for other devices unclear.
- Introduction of [Alexa.com](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/26/alexa-costs-19-99-or-free-for-prime-members/) for long-form work and a refreshed mobile app.
- Alexa+ pricing is competitive with ChatGPT and Google's Gemini Advanced, both at $19.99.
- Initial rumors suggested a price between $5 to $10 for a potential trial offer.
- Amazon's new AI-powered Alexa Plus will not support many first-generation Echo devices.
- Excluded devices include first-generation Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Plus, Echo Tap, Echo Spot, and second-generation Echo Show.
- Some early Echo devices will still function with standard Alexa for basic commands like controlling lights and checking weather.

sources.title: Alexa+ costs $19.99, free for Amazon Prime members
Alexa Plus leaves behind Amazon's earliest Echo devices

title: Tech Companies Reassess Diversity Initiatives Amid Political Backlash
summary:
- Google eliminates diversity hiring targets and will review DEI programs.
- DEI targets aimed for a 30% increase in underrepresented hires by 2020.
- Google's 2024 diversity report shows only 5.7% Black and 7.5% Latino representation.
- Other companies ending DEI programs include Meta and Amazon.
- Pinterest cites DEI attacks as potential business risks in its [latest 10-K filing](https://d18rn0p25nwr6d.cloudfront.net/CIK-0001506293/973659c6-d9a4-483b-a151-22b4a2a5bd9e.pdf).
- Google removed cultural events like Black History Month and Pride Month from the default calendar in mid-2024.
- OpenAI redirected its diversity commitment page to emphasize inclusivity without DEI language.
- Companies responding to legal and political pressures, including an executive order from Trump.
- Major corporations like McDonald's, Harley Davidson, and Goldman Sachs are scaling back DEI policies.
- Apple and JPMorgan are maintaining their commitment to diversity initiatives.

sources.title: Google ditches DEI hiring goals

title: Inception emerges from stealth with a new type of AI model
summary:
- Inception is a Palo Alto-based company founded by Stanford professor Stefano Ermon, focused on a new diffusion-based AI model called DLM.
- Inception's model combines the capabilities of traditional LLMs with faster performance and lower costs.
- The model allows for generating and modifying large blocks of text in parallel, unlike traditional LLMs which are sequential.
- Inception has already secured customers, including Fortune 100 companies, addressing a need for reduced AI latency.
- The company offers an API and various deployment options, claiming its DLMs are up to 10x faster and cost 10x less than traditional LLMs.
- A company spokesperson stated that their models can perform as well as OpenAI’s GPT-4o mini but with greater speed.

summary:
- UAE and France signed an agreement for an AI data center investment of €30 to €50 billion ($31 to $52 billion).
- Planned capacity of the data center is up to 1GW, supporting the upcoming AI Action Summit in Paris.
- France is targeting foreign investments with 35 locations for new data centers focusing on renewable energy.
- Consortium including Emirati firm MGX will finance the project; groundbreaking expected in winter 2025.
- Apple commits $500 billion to US manufacturing with a new AI server facility in Houston, expected to complete by 2026.
- Apple’s investment includes doubling the US Advanced Manufacturing Fund to $10 billion and enhancing AI capabilities in U.S. data centers.
- Governor Kim Yung-Rok of Jeollanam-do Province signed a US$35 billion AI data center agreement with Fir Hills Inc.

- Construction scheduled to begin in winter 2025, with an expected job creation of 10,000 positions in the province.

title: Hacked crypto exchange Bybit offers $140 million bounty to trace stolen funds
summary:
- Hackers stole around $1.4 billion in Ethereum from Bybit, the largest crypto heist in history.
- Bybit is offering $140 million in bounties for tracing and freezing the stolen funds.
- CEO Ben Zhou announced the bounty on X, with rewards of 5% for those who trace and 5% for the entity that freezes the funds.
- $4.23 million has already been awarded to bounty hunters.
- The cybersecurity group Lazarus, linked to North Korea, is suspected to be behind the hack.
- Security firms reported that a developer's device at SafeWallet was breached, leading to the hack.

- Users can traverse a world map in a virtual hot air balloon, exploring sights scanned by Niantic's technology.
- Niantic aims to create a large collection of 3D scans, enhancing visibility of high-quality images that flat photos may not do justice.

title: Streaming Services Are Increasing Prices: Latest Updates
summary:
- Streaming services like Netflix, Disney Plus, Hulu, and Peacock have raised their subscription prices repeatedly over recent years.
- Companies are reacting to increased demand for content, higher production costs, and the need to sustain revenue amid cable cancellations.
- Password sharing is being cracked down on as a revenue recovery strategy while adding ads has not prevented price hikes.
- Max will remove CNN and Bleacher Report Sports add-ons from its ad-supported tier on March 30, 2025, impacting viewers who want to maintain access to these services.
- Amazon Music Unlimited has increased its subscription prices for both Prime and non-Prime members and family plans, effective from January 29, 2025.
- Netflix has raised the monthly price of its standard plan to $17.99.
- Fubo TV has also raised its monthly prices due to rising costs from programming partners, with the cheapest plan now at $85.

- It claims to outperform Google Gemini 2.0 Flash and Whisper Large V3 in benchmark tests.
- Pricing is set at $0.40 per hour of transcribed audio, competitive among rivals.

- The company aims to improve speech detection beyond existing solutions.

title: Prioritise artists over tech in AI copyright debate, MPs say
summary:

- Caroline Dinenage highlights the concern that AI could exploit creators' work without permission, equating it to allowing theft unless explicitly prohibited.
- The committees demand clearer guidelines on AI's use of copyrighted works and suggest stronger transparency requirements for training data.
- A letter to ministers indicates that without proper regulations, the financial impact on creators could worsen, especially for those already constrained.

title: How to hide faces and scrub metadata when you photograph a protest
summary:

• Use built-in photo editors on iOS and Android to cover faces.
• Taking screenshots of images can be a simple way to avoid metadata.
• Encrypted messaging apps like Signal offer face-blurring tools.

title: At 10, USB-C still hasn’t lived up to its full potential
summary:

- Sustained use led to an increase in USB-C cable accumulation, highlighting a paradox of supposed standardization.

- Current frustrations include insufficient quality information on cables and the challenge of sustainability in tech ecosystems.

title: Hackers Steal and Publish Sensitive Data from Australian IVF Provider Genea
summary:
- Ransomware payments fell by over a third to $813 million in 2024, down from $1.25 billion in 2023.
- Major incidents included attacks on NHS trusts and Krispy Kreme.
- Decline attributed to victims refusing to pay and intensified law enforcement actions against [cybercriminals](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=cybercrime).
- Payments for 2024 lower than previous years, below 2020's $999 million and 2019's $1.1 billion.
- Expert Jacqueline Burns Koven suggests this indicates averted 'ransomware apocalypse' due to effective collaboration and victim resistance.
- UK ministers consider a ban on ransomware payments by public entities.
- Payments dropped more than 35% in 2024, with hacker demands 53% higher than actual payments in the year's second half.
- Law enforcement targeted major ransomware groups like BlackCat and Lockbit in 2024.
- International law enforcement seized the 8base ransomware gang's dark web leak site.
- Global operation arrested four Russian nationals linked to over 1,000 ransomware attacks.
- Named “Phobos Aetor,” the operation targeted the 8base group in Phuket, Thailand.
- Evidence includes over 40 pieces seized and more than 100 servers shut down.
- The FBI warned that Phobos ransomware targeted critical infrastructure in the U.S.
- Charges were unsealed against two suspects for operating the 8base affiliate.
- Leaked chat logs revealed internal tensions within the Black Basta group.
- Hackers published sensitive data from IVF patients after a cyberattack on Genea.
- Genea CEO confirmed data was published externally following the breach.
- Termite ransomware gang claimed responsibility, breaching Genea’s Citrix environment on January 31.
- Data breach involved about 940 GB of data, accessing patient management information without compromising financial details.
- Genea is working to restore systems and communicate with affected patients.

title: Microsoft’s Majorana 1 widened the quantum field. But are we any closer to a eureka moment?
summary:
- Microsoft has achieved a breakthrough with eight topological qubits on their Majorana 1 chip, published in Nature.
- The development suggests a viable approach towards quantum computing, but eight qubits are far from the millions needed for full-scale computing.
- Competitors like IBM and Google are more advanced with different methodologies, while Microsoft's topological method may offer advantages regarding noise resistance.
- Experts caution that this does not signify imminent commercial quantum computers from Microsoft; rather, it's an indication of potential in a competitive landscape.

title: Microsoft's Majorana 1 Chip and GitHub Data Exposure Issues
summary:

- Opinions vary in the tech industry regarding the timeline for practical quantum computing, with predictions ranging from 5 to 20 years.
- Security researchers warn that briefly exposed data on GitHub may persist in generative AI tools like Microsoft Copilot.
- Over 20,000 previously public GitHub repositories are still accessible via Copilot, affecting more than 16,000 organizations including Amazon, Google, IBM, and Microsoft.
- Lasso, a cybersecurity firm, discovered that Copilot could retrieve sensitive information even from repositories set to private or deleted, prompting recommendations for affected organizations to revoke compromised data.

title: Startup fraud in Asia may be blown out of proportion
summary:

- High-profile fraud cases can give a misleading impression of the prevalence of startup fraud in the regions.
- The majority of known fraud cases are concentrated in a few firms, notably Byju's, which accounts for 75% of reported cases.
- Local investors may benefit from reduced competition for good deals amidst the fraud concerns.

title: Apple Chips Vulnerabilities Allow Data Leak from Browsers
summary:
- Apple-designed chips in Macs, iPhones, and iPads have two vulnerabilities leaking sensitive data from Chrome and Safari.  
- Vulnerabilities enable side channel attacks via speculative execution optimizations, affecting A- and M-series chip sets.  
- The more significant attack, FLOP, can read sensitive data like location history and credit card info from targeted sites.  
- SLAP is limited to reading adjacent strings from another webpage.  
- Affected devices include recent Mac laptops, desktops, iPads, and iPhones since 2021.  
- Researchers suggest potential mitigations and await patch plans from Apple, although Apple claims there's no immediate risk.

sources.title: Apple Chips Vulnerabilities Allow Data Leak from Browsers

title: How much does ChatGPT cost? Everything you need to know about OpenAI’s pricing plans
summary:
- OpenAI’s ChatGPT offers a variety of pricing plans, including free and paid options for individuals, businesses, and educational institutions.
- The free version allows access to the GPT-4o mini model with limited features; users can save chat preferences and analyze uploaded data.
- ChatGPT Plus costs $20/month, allows 80 messages to GPT-4o every three hours, and includes more advanced features like multimodal capabilities.
- ChatGPT Pro, priced at $200/month, provides unlimited access to models and the latest features along with priority support.
- ChatGPT Team is available for $30/user/month, focusing on collaboration for small businesses, while ChatGPT Enterprise targets larger organizations with pricing based on user volume.
- OpenAI for Nonprofits offers discounted plans for eligible organizations, including ChatGPT Team and ChatGPT Enterprise at reduced rates.
- The article was updated on February 25, 2025, to reflect new pricing and features.

- The 9100 Pro features up to 2,200K read and 2,600K write IOPS, significantly faster than the last-gen 980 Pro.
- Sequential read speed up to 14.8GBps and write speed of 13.4GBps, catering to heavy computing and large file transfers needs.
- Custom controller built on V Nand TLC V8 technology, providing enhanced performance for future workloads.

title: Kate Bush, Annie Lennox, and a slew of other stars are on this silent album. Here’s why

- Profits from the album will go to the charity Help Musicians.

title: Indonesia antitrust agency fines Carro $92k for late report

title: Japan semiconductor stocks drop on US-China chip woes

- Bybit is conducting an investigation; however, it has not commented on the North Korea link.
- As of February 24, 2025, Bybit announced that 80% of the stolen Ethereum has been recovered and client funds are secure.

title: Strategy Acquires 20,356 Bitcoins for $2 Billion Amid Rising Institutional Interest
summary:
- Strategy, formerly MicroStrategy, has intensified its bitcoin acquisition, holding 471,107 bitcoins valued at approximately $20.5 billion, accounting for 2% of total bitcoin supply.
- In Q4, the firm completed nearly $20 billion of its $42 billion capital acquisition strategy.
- Acquired 7.633 bitcoins for $742 million at an average price of $97,255 each between Feb. 3 and Feb. 9.
- Total holdings increased to 478,740 bitcoins worth over $46 billion, approximately 2.2% of the total bitcoin supply.
- Funding for these acquisitions came from Class A common stock and series A preferred share sales totaling $742 million.
- The rebrand to Strategy includes the “₿” symbol, coinciding with significant bitcoin acquisitions totaling around $20 billion.
- Standard Chartered anticipates increased interest in bitcoin from sovereign wealth funds, with Abu Dhabi's fund investing 4,700 BTC in BlackRock's bitcoin ETF.
- Recent SEC filings show rising institutional interest, particularly from hedge funds and a shift towards sovereign funds.
- Standard Chartered predicts bitcoin could reach $500,000 by 2028 due to improved institutional access and decreased volatility.
- Strategy acquired 20,356 bitcoins for approximately $2 billion between Feb. 18 and Feb. 23, disclosing this in an 8-K filing on Feb. 24.
- Total bitcoin holdings now stand at 499,096 bitcoins, valued over $47 billion, with an average purchase price of $66,357 per bitcoin.

title: Nvidia Addresses Manufacturing Issues in RTX 5080, 5090, and 5070 Ti Cards
summary:
- Nvidia has confirmed a manufacturing issue impacting less than 0.5% of RTX 5090, 5090D, and 5070 Ti GPUs, which are missing one render output unit (ROP).
- Average performance impact is reported at 4%, with no effect on AI or compute tasks.
- Affected consumers are eligible for replacements from their board manufacturers; the production issue is resolved.
- Multiple manufacturers like Zotac, MSI, Gigabyte, Manli, and Nvidia Founders Edition are affected, users should verify using GPU-Z.

- Early production builds of RTX 5080 were also affected by a manufacturing issue, missing some render units.
- Affected models include RTX 5090, RTX 5090D, RTX 5070 Ti, and now RTX 5080.
- Less than 0.5% of these GPUs face a 4% average performance decrease but no impact on AI and Compute workloads.
- Consumers can contact their board manufacturer for replacements.
- The production anomaly has been fixed, and newer cards are not impacted.
- The issue was initially discovered by a Reddit user who found their RTX 5080 missing ROPs, and the card will be sent for examination.

sources.title: Nvidia confirms ‘rare’ RTX 5090 and 5070 Ti manufacturing issue

title: Ongoing Attacks Target Ivanti VPNs Exploiting Critical Vulnerability and New Backdoor Discovered
summary:
- Ivanti VPN networks are under active attack exploiting the critical vulnerability [CVE-2025-0282](https://arstechnica.com/security/2025/01/ivanti-vpn-users-are-getting-hacked-by-actors-exploiting-a-critical-vulnerability/).
- This vulnerability allows complete control over network-connected devices with no authentication required.
- A security patch was released, upgrading Connect Secure devices to version 22.7R2.5.
- Attackers exploit this vulnerability to install new malware packages, DRYHOOK and PHASEJAM.
- PHASEJAM creates a web shell for remote access and simulates the upgrade process to deceive administrators.
- SPAWNANT malware is also used to disable Ivanti's integrity checker for device files.
- Researchers revealed a new backdoor, J-Magic, affecting enterprise VPNs using Juniper's Junos OS.
- The backdoor remains dormant until it receives a 'magic packet', which includes a challenge encrypted with an RSA key.
- J-Magic only exists in memory, making it harder to detect and has been identified in 36 organizations' networks.

sources.title: Ongoing attacks on Ivanti VPNs install a ton of sneaky, well-written malware
Backdoor infecting VPNs used “magic packets” for stealth and security

title: Epic Games v. Apple: Key Testimonies on App Store Commissions and Developer Relations
summary:
- Phil Schiller testified he raised concerns about a 27% commission on external purchases.
- He warned it could create an antagonistic relationship with app developers and raise compliance risks.
- This commission reduction followed a court ruling that allowed developers to link to alternative payment methods.
- Apple's default commission is 30%, but it dropped to 27% due to legal pressures.
- Epic Games' CEO criticized Apple's compliance stating it was insufficient.
- Schiller worried that Apple would become a collection agency affecting its relationship with developers.
- Internal discussions revealed a lengthy debate at Apple regarding the commissions and potential impacts.
- It was ultimately decided to charge a commission on external purchases despite Schiller's objections.
- Documents indicated Apple considered how to implement external links without losing transactions.
- New guidelines allow for a week to charge for external purchases after a link is clicked.
- Apple must produce 1.3 million documents related to App Store changes by a court deadline.
- Epic Games argues that the fees Apple charges for outside payment links violate a 2021 court order.
- Only 38 out of 65,000 developers have applied for alternative payment methods approved by Apple.
- A judge expressed skepticism towards Apple's rationale regarding the implementation of fees for alternative payment links.
- Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers will hold hearings to further address whether Apple is complying with court orders on payment systems.

title: SpaceX Explains Starship Explosion Cause and Plans for Upcoming Test Flight
summary:

- The explosion was visually striking, affecting air traffic over Turks and Caicos as flights were diverted.
- Modifications have been made to fuel lines and engines to mitigate future risks.
- The cause was detailed as fires in the aft section, causing engine shutdowns on January 16, 2025.
- The Super Heavy booster succeeded in its mission, being caught mid-air by the launch tower.
- Sustained fires triggered the self-destruct system three minutes after communications were lost.
- Ongoing investigation involves multiple agencies, with hardware changes for future flights.
- The next test flight is tentatively scheduled for February 28, 2025, subject to regulatory approval.

title: How agentic AI will shape the future of business
summary: - Amazon introduced an AI-powered HR assistant in 2024 for performance reviews and workforce planning. - Tesla deployed AI personas for production monitoring and supply chain optimization. - AI personas are defined by their function, epistemic perspective, and relationship type, enabling organizations to streamline processes. - Agentic AI systems can autonomously make decisions and take actions based on real-time data. - Examples of agentic AI include Tesla's inventory management, JPMorgan’s adaptive trading algorithms, and Darktrace’s cyber defense. - Challenges include maintaining authenticity and trust, managing emotional engagement with AI, and setting boundaries for AI autonomy. - Effective AI integration requires purposeful design aligned with goals, a human-centered approach, ethical frameworks, and continuous monitoring. - The OPEN framework assists organizations in unlocking AI potential through systematic planning and experimentation, while the CARE framework helps manage AI-related risks. - The future of AI personas and agentic AI is promising, emphasizing the need for balancing technology with ethical considerations and human values.

sources.title: How agentic AI will shape the future of business

title: TikTok (with Douyin) becomes first app to reach $6B in annual consumer spending
summary:

- TikTok's IAP revenue represents a significant increase from $4.4 billion in 2023.
- Despite high revenue, TikTok was ranked No. 2 in downloads for Q4 2024, behind Instagram.
- Douyin, tailored for the Chinese audience, offers stricter content controls and emphasizes e-commerce more than TikTok.
- TikTok's popularity illustrates its importance in the creator economy, where users can purchase virtual gifts for creators.

summary:

- Bongino's online influence includes being labeled a top election conspiracy "misinformation superspreader" by global human rights group Avaaz.

title: Monster Hunter Wilds thrives on spectacle
summary: - Monster Hunter Wilds features battles against enormous monsters in diverse environments, emphasizing a spectacle-driven gameplay experience. - The game continues the open-world format established in Monster Hunter World, keeping the core mechanics while introducing new elements and more cinematic battles. - Set in the Forbidden Lands, players follow a storyline involving a decimated village and a creature called The White Wraith, alongside deeper monster-targeting mechanics and a second weapon type for mounts. - Wilds is recognized as the most accessible entry in the series, with seamless area transitions, despite some rigid menu challenges during gameplay. - The game launches on February 28th on PC, PS5, and Xbox, continuing the thrilling hunt experience the series is known for.

title: EFishery investors may recover just below 10% of their investments
summary:
- Investors in eFishery may recover only less than 10% of their investments due to misconduct allegations against founders.
- A report from FTI Consulting indicates eFishery is not commercially viable in its current form, recommending a partial wind-down.
- eFishery has approximately US$50 million in cash reserves, quickly depleting without a restructuring plan.
- Once valued at US$1.4 billion, the startup raised US$315 million with prominent investors like SoftBank and Temasek.
- Under optimistic conditions, recovery is estimated at 9.5 cents on the dollar; conservative estimates drop it to 8.3 cents.
- About 76% of its US$68 million in accounts receivable is now deemed bad debt, with operational inefficiencies noted.
- Investigators cited significant gaps in promised technology, including undeployed sensors, as contributors to losses.

sources.title: EFishery investors may recover just below 10% of their investments

title: How to set up crash detection on your Android phone
summary:
- Crash detection feature utilizes movement sensors to detect driving and sudden stops.
- Available on Pixel phones starting with the Google Pixel 4A and compatible with Pixel Watch 2 and 3.
- If a crash is detected, the phone and watch will sound an alarm and inquire about the status, with options to cancel or notify emergency services.
- Automatic alerts are sent out if there is no response after 60 seconds.
- Instructions for enabling crash detection on Pixel phones include using the Personal Safety app and setting up emergency contacts.
- For Pixel Watches, feature status syncs across devices, and can be managed via the Pixel Watch app or directly on the watch.

- Many students now find campus life lonely, with fewer attending in-person classes due to work commitments and the convenience of online learning.
- The expectation of a vibrant university life clashes with the reality of reduced social interaction and engagement on campus, leading to a diminished sense of community.
- Australian students are increasingly juggling coursework with jobs, prioritizing work over university social life.
- The trend towards online learning, driven by cost-saving measures, has resulted in larger class sizes and reduced contact hours, impacting educational quality and student satisfaction.

title: What’s the deal with all these airplane crashes?
summary:
- Four commercial jet crashes occurred within ten weeks: 1) Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 8243 on Christmas Day, 2) Jeju Air Flight 7C2216 on December 29, 3) American Airlines Flight 5342 on January 29, and 4) Delta Connection Flight 4819 on February 17.
- The NTSB reports 13 fatal airplane crashes in the U.S. since the start of the year, covering both private and commercial flights.
- The FAA announced layoffs of around 400 employees, impacting critical roles such as mechanics and flight safety specialists.
- Aviation safety has improved over the years, with only a small risk of accidents; statistically, chances of a fatal crash remain about 1 in 2 million.
- Despite recent crashes, airline safety systems remain under strain due to staffing shortages and outdated infrastructure, particularly in air traffic control.

title: UK delays plans to regulate AI as ministers seek to align with Trump administration
summary:

- Concerns about advanced AI models posing risks to humanity are driving the need for regulation, yet uncertainty remains due to political changes in the US.
- The UK government has opted not to support international regulatory agreements, instead aiming to attract US AI investment.
- Artists are raising concerns over plans to allow AI companies to use online creative material without copyright permissions.

title: Apple's Strategic Responses: $500 Billion US Investment and Tariff Challenges
summary:
- The iPhone 16 is banned in Indonesia due to Apple's non-compliance with local manufacturing regulations.
- Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita has yet to lift the ban despite Apple's $1 billion investment proposal.
- Indonesia uses the ban to encourage local manufacturing investments from Apple, enhancing Kartasasmita's political leverage.

* Apple plans to invest over $500 billion in the US in the next four years, creating 20,000 jobs and building a new server factory in Texas.
* This investment follows a meeting between Tim Cook and President Trump amid impending tariff threats on Chinese imports.
* The new Houston factory, set to open next year, will produce servers for Apple’s AI initiatives, generating thousands of jobs.
* Apple's Advanced Manufacturing Fund is being doubled from $5 billion to $10 billion to support US manufacturing.
* Additionally, an Apple Manufacturing Academy will be established in Detroit to assist local businesses and provide training.
* This announcement builds on a previous $430 billion commitment from 2021, which included a paused 3,000-employee campus in North Carolina.

- A planned multiplayer mode was cut; however, competitive leaderboards were included.

title: Tesla recalls over 370k vehicles for steering system issue
summary:
- Tesla is recalling 376,241 vehicles in the US over a potential issue with power-assisted steering systems.
- Affected models include Model 3 and Model Y manufactured between Feb. 28, 2023, and Oct. 11, 2023.
- The issue involves overstressed printed circuit boards that may lead to steering failure when stopping and accelerating.
- If power-assisted steering fails, drivers may need more effort to steer, increasing accident risk.
- Tesla is unaware of any related crashes or injuries and is offering an over-the-air software update as a solution.
- This recall follows an investigation and a voluntary recall in China for similar issues.

- It accuses Musk of acting against Canada's national interest by advising Trump, who has threatened Canadian sovereignty.

- Initial funding is projected at 326 trillion rupiah (US$20 billion) for 15 to 20 large-scale projects aimed at national economic growth, managing assets exceeding 14,710 trillion rupiah (US$900 billion).
- The focus will be on sustainable investments in renewable energy, advanced manufacturing, and food production to support an 8% GDP growth goal.
- President Subianto insisted that Danantara must be open to audits by any party, emphasizing the need for careful management and oversight to protect national interests.

title: US Asks EU Antitrust Chief for Clarity on Big Tech Rules Amid DMA Changes
summary:
- The EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA) imposes new regulations on major tech companies like Apple and Google.
- Apple will allow sideloading and alternative app stores on iPhones.
- Google is modifying its services, including Search and Chrome, to meet DMA requirements, impacting user experience.
- Both companies are under scrutiny for potential anti-competitive practices.
- The DMA seeks to enhance competition and consumer options in the digital landscape.
- US House Judiciary Committee chairman Jim Jordan seeks clarification from EU antitrust chief Teresa Ribera regarding the implications for US firms.
- Concerns highlighted in a letter signed by Scott Fitzgerald relate to the effects of the regulation on American companies.
- The letter, from February 23, reflects ongoing US scrutiny of the DMA and DSA following President Trump’s memorandum.
- The DMA targets firms like Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, and Microsoft, aiming to boost competition and consumer choice.
- Non-compliance with the DMA may result in fines up to 10% of a company's global annual revenue.

title: ChatGPT tops 2m weekly users in S Korea after DeepSeek ban

title: Bybit CEO Guarantees Recovery of 80% of Stolen Ethereum in Major Heist
summary:
- Bybit, a cryptocurrency exchange, reported a $1.5bn theft, the largest digital theft in history.
- The attack exploited security flaws during a wallet transfer, leading to the theft of Ethereum assets.
- Bybit assures customers of fund safety and promises refunds to affected users.
- CEO Ben Zhou stated the exchange holds $20bn in assets to cover losses.
- Withdrawal requests surged post-hack, causing possible delays.
- Ethereum's price dropped nearly 4% but has since stabilized.
- Bybit is seeking cybersecurity expertise to recover funds, offering a 10% reward for returns.
- The incident is seen as a setback for the crypto industry, potentially linked to previous hacks by groups like Lazarus.
- 401,000 Ethereum, worth over $1.5bn, was stolen on February 21 through a cold wallet breach.
- Ben Zhou announced nearly 80% of stolen Ethereum has been recovered via a bridge loan from partners.
- Withdrawals are functional but may face delays due to ongoing checks.
- This attack surpassed the Ronin Network heist as the largest in cryptocurrency history.
- Bybit is collaborating with legal authorities to recover stolen assets.

title: Grok 3 Censorship and Controversial AI Responses Regarding Trump and Musk
summary:

- Grok 3, launched by Elon Musk's xAI, was designed to be a 'maximally truth-seeking AI'.

title: Bybit Offers $140 Million Recovery Bounty After $1.4 Billion Hack
summary:
- Bybit announced a hack leading to the theft of approximately 401,346 ETH, valued at around $1.4 billion.
- This incident marks the largest known theft of cryptocurrency to date.
- CEO Ben Zhou stated the hacker gained access to a cold wallet.
- Despite the loss, Bybit remains solvent and can cover the theft.
- Bybit's total assets were estimated at $16 billion as of last week, based in Dubai.
- Hackers primarily targeted the cold wallet, draining $1.5 billion in digital assets.
- North Korea's Lazarus Group was identified as the perpetrator.
- Bybit has launched a recovery bounty program, offering up to $140 million for assistance in recovering the stolen funds.

title: Southeast Asia Insurtech Funding Decline and Education Startup Investment Insights
summary:
- Insurtech funding in Southeast Asia fell 61% in 2024 to US$193 million from US$495 million in 2023.
- The decline is attributed to global economic challenges such as inflation and geopolitical uncertainties.
- Seed-stage funding decreased by 16% to US$7.7 million; early-stage investments dropped 80% to US$38.5 million.
- Late-stage funding increased by 11% to US$147 million, with [Bolttech](https://www.techinasia.com/news/southeast-asia-insurtech-funding-drops-61-in-2024-report) securing the largest deal at US$100 million.
- A funding rebound in H2 2024 reached US$111 million, a 35% increase from H1 but 50% lower than H2 2023.
- Singapore led funding with US$135 million, followed by Jakarta (US$50.5 million) and Kuala Lumpur (US$1.2 million).
- Acquisition activity slowed with only one deal recorded, compared to five in 2023.
- No new unicorns emerged for the second consecutive year.
- Despite the drop in funding, indications of recovery exist due to government initiatives and global interest.
- The article reviews active investors in Southeast Asia's education startups over the past two years, featuring investors that have invested in three or more companies.
- Data accuracy remains a goal, and reader feedback on inaccuracies is encouraged.

summary:

title: Indian furniture retailer Pepperfry’s revenue drops 31% in FY24
summary:

- Total income decreased by 28% year-on-year to ₹209.2 crore (US$24.14 million).
- Net loss narrowed by 37.4% to ₹117.5 crore (US$13.56 million), and EBITDA loss decreased by 52.2% to ₹43.6 crore (US$5.03 million).
- Total expenditures dropped 31.1% to ₹326.7 crore (US$37.70 million).
- Employee expenses were cut by 29.7%, and marketing costs were reduced by nearly 45%.
- Founded in 2012, Pepperfry operates in 173 cities with over 200 studios.
- The company has raised over US$305 million, and announced plans for an IPO were shelved in 2024 amid stagnant sales.
- Originally aiming for 10-15% revenue growth in FY25, the path to profitability remains uncertain.

title: Meta's Controversial AI Training Practices Under Scrutiny in Court Filings
summary:
- New court filings in the case of [Kadrey v. Meta Platforms](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/67569326/kadrey-v-meta-platforms-inc/?order_by=desc) indicate Meta has paused discussions with book publishers for AI training data licensing.
- Meta's AI partnership lead, Sy Choudhury, reported slow engagement from publishers during outreach efforts, leading to the decision to pause licensing efforts in early April 2023 due to logistical setbacks.
- The plaintiffs, including authors Sarah Silverman and Ta-Nehisi Coates, allege Meta may have used pirated ebooks for AI model training, raising concerns over copyright infringement.
- Unsealed court documents disclose that Meta employees discussed the use of copyrighted content to train AI models.
- A research engineer suggested purchasing e-books at retail prices for speed, despite legal concerns.
- Meta considered using Libgen for accessing copyrighted books and debated how to avoid public acknowledgment of such actions.
- Some insiders argued that existing data from Facebook and Instagram might not suffice for advanced AI training, driving a push for more extensive datasets, even against previous decisions regarding copyrighted content.
- The Kadrey v. Meta case, initiated in 2023 in California, accuses Meta of analyzing both pirated and licensed books for potential licensing negotiations.

- Noise-cancelling headphones are valued for reducing background noise but may impair auditory skills.
- Audiologists report an increase in adults with auditory processing issues, not due to ear health but brain function.
- Concerns arise that excessive use of noise-cancelling tech could weaken the brain’s ability to process multiple sound sources.
- The condition known as auditory processing disorder (APD) traditionally diagnosed in children is now seen in adults, possibly due to technology use.
- Lack of scientific evidence linking headphones to APD raises the need for further studies, especially on impacts of long-term use in younger users.
- APD affects about 3-5% of children, linked to issues like low birth weight and chronic ear infections.
- Experts suggest that while benefits of noise-cancelling are recognized, risks warrant more in-depth research, especially regarding impact on children’s auditory skills.

sources.title: Filter trouble? Why audiologists worry noise-cancelling tech may impair hearing skills

title: Meta Staff Discuss Copyrighted Content Use and First Major AI Fair Use Ruling
summary:
- A US judge ruled that Ross Intelligence cannot use Thomson Reuters content for its AI-based legal platform.
- This is the first fair use decision in an AI copyright case.
- Fair use is often cited by tech firms in AI training disputes, but copyright holders argue it harms their businesses.
- Thomson Reuters supported the ruling, asserting that Ross's use did not meet fair use criteria.
- A U.S. federal judge issued a summary judgment in a case against Ross Intelligence by Thomson Reuters regarding AI training material.
- The judge ruled Ross infringed on Reuters' intellectual property by using headnotes from Westlaw for its AI legal research tool.
- The judge deemed Ross' argument of transformative use unconvincing, as it did not add new meaning or purpose.
- The ruling may influence other pending AI copyright cases, although its narrow application is noted.
- The decision distinguishes between Ross' AI, which does not generate content, and generative AI, leading to further discussions on fair use in AI training data.
- Meta employees debated the use of copyrighted works for AI training through questionable means, revealed in court documents from the Kadrey v. Meta case.
- Plaintiffs, including authors Sarah Silverman and Ta-Nehisi Coates, oppose Meta's claim of ‘fair use’ regarding copyrighted content.
- Internal chats expose discussions around prioritizing speed over legal considerations in acquiring copyrighted materials for AI training, including using platforms like Libgen and the idea of buying e-books at retail prices.

title: How to set up crash detection on your iPhone and Apple Watch
summary:

- The feature is turned on by default but can be checked in Settings under Emergency SOS.
- If activated, it sends an SOS alert after 20 seconds of no response to emergency services.
- For iPhone setup: Go to Settings > Emergency SOS > Call After Severe Crash > Set up Emergency Contacts in Health.
- For Apple Watch: Use the Apple Watch app on iPhone or Settings app on the watch to enable Crash Detection.

- The startup aims to build AI models to "make biology programmable" and collaborate with biotech companies to optimize proteins.
- Latent Labs aims to reduce reliance on wet labs for drug discovery and expedite research and development processes.
- The funding includes a $10 million seed round and a $40 million series A round, co-led by Radical Ventures and Sofinnova Partners.
- The company is based in London and San Francisco and has a team of about 15 employees.
- Latent Labs will collaborate with biotech and pharmaceutical companies, focusing on AI models and project partnerships.

- CircNova, a Michigan biotech startup, raised $3.3 million in a seed round for AI-driven therapies targeting circular RNA.
- Co-founder Crystal Brown transitioned from automotive manufacturing to biotech, leveraging her business experience to build the startup.
- CircNova's AI engine, similar to Google’s AlphaFold, is designed to identify and produce circular RNA for therapeutic applications, aiming to treat diseases like ovarian cancer and neurodegenerative conditions.
- The startup, founded in May 2023, has already made significant advancements, including the first patent application, with backing from various investors focused on diversity.

sources.title: Latent Labs Launches with $50M to Make Biology Programmable
Ex-DeepMind scientist launches biotech AI startup with $50m

title: Why a proposed ban on lab-grown meat is getting pushback from Nebraska ranchers
summary:

- Governor Jim Pillen supports the ban, aiming to protect traditional meat producers, with an executive order previously signed to restrict procurement of lab-grown meat.
- Ranchers like Dan Morgan advocate for competition, stating regulation should focus on safety and labeling, leaving consumer choice intact.
- Approximately a dozen states have proposed similar bans; Florida and Alabama have already enacted them.
- Opposition highlights concerns regarding safety, yet many believe the ban serves to protect existing agricultural interests rather than public health.

title: Report: AI coding assistants aren’t a panacea
summary:
- AI coding assistants like [GitHub Copilot](https://techcrunch.com/tag/github-copilot/) are becoming popular but may decrease code quality.
- A report by [GitClear](https://leaddev.com/software-quality/how-ai-generated-code-accelerates-technical-debt) analyzed 211 million code lines between 2020 and 2024, noting a decline in code reuse.
- Surveys indicate mixed results, where developers spend more time debugging AI-generated code and security vulnerabilities compared to human-written code. Reports from [Harness](https://leaddev.com/velocity/how-speed-code-reviews) and [Google](https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/devops-sre/announcing-the-2024-dora-report) highlight trade-offs between speed and stability in code reviews and documentation.

title: Every hour children spend on screens raises chance of myopia, study finds
summary:
- Researchers found each hour on screens increases the risk of myopia in children.
- Involvement of 335,524 participants across 45 studies reveals a 21% higher risk of myopia with an extra hour of screen time.
- Risks rise steeply with daily screen time; 54% higher odds for those already myopic with additional hour of screen use.
- Study suggests a potential safety threshold for screen use below one hour daily.
- Limitations include reliance on self-reports and the need for further evidence to understand causation.

title: Risk of Asteroid Hitting Earth in 2032 Significantly Lowered
summary:
- The European Space Agency reports the probability of asteroid 2024 YR4 hitting Earth has dropped to 0.16%.
- Initial estimates had placed the impact risk at 3.1%, marking the highest recorded probability for an object of its size.
- Observations will continue until April 2028, with further study planned using the James Webb Space Telescope.
- The asteroid, first identified on December 27, 2024, is estimated to be 130 to 300 feet wide and would deliver an impact energy of 7.7 megatons.
- Updated data indicates a 1% chance of impacting the moon instead.

title: Tesla Launches Virtual Queue to Address EV Charging Delays in the US
summary:

- The system will initially roll out at select locations, with a broader launch planned later based on user feedback.
- This initiative follows reports of disputes at Supercharger stations due to limited ports frustrating EV drivers.
- The EV charging landscape in North America resembles smartphone charging wars with a focus on infrastructure and costs.
- Tesla is promoting its North American Charging Standard (NACS) while gradually standardizing it among major automakers like Ford, GM, and Toyota.
- The federal government has allocated $7.5 billion for reliable EV infrastructure development.
- Kia EVs will gain access to Tesla Supercharger stations in March 2025; there's been a delay in the rollout of NACS compatibility.
- Mercedes-Benz EVs can use Tesla's Supercharger network starting February 2025 through NACS-to-CCS adapters.

title: The GSA is shutting down its EV chargers, calling them ‘not mission critical’
summary:

- Official guidance to begin shutting down chargers will be announced next week, with some offices already informed to take them offline.
- GSA is also looking to offload newly purchased electric vehicles (EVs).
- This move contradicts previous efforts under the Biden administration to promote EV usage and reduce the federal government's carbon footprint.
- Under Biden, the GSA had ordered over 58,000 EVs and planned to install over 25,000 charging ports.

title: The ups and downs of the iPhone 16E + The standard iPhone needs ProMotion more than ever
summary:
- Apple aims to attract price-sensitive customers with the new [iPhone 16E](https://www.theverge.com/apple/616134/iphone-16e-promotion-120-hz-display), similar to the iPhone SE.
- The iPhone 16E features an OLED display, FaceID, the latest processor, and a customizable Action Button, but lacks a dual-camera setup.
- Apple needs to differentiate the standard iPhone from the Pro models more clearly, potentially by introducing a 120Hz ProMotion display.
- Competing brands like Google and Samsung offer high-refresh rate displays in more affordable models, challenging Apple's pricing strategy.
- A 120Hz display would enhance user experience with smoother scrolling and functionality such as always-on display mode.
- The iPhone 16E offers a modern processor, good camera, and appealing design at a lower price point compared to typical new devices.
- It lacks some features found in other iPhones, like MagSafe and multiple cameras, raising questions about its target market.
- The [Vergecast](https://www.theverge.com/the-vergecast/617137/iphone-16e-humane-ai-pin-vergecast) discusses Apple's pricing strategies, the significance of the new C1 modem, and other recent tech news, including the demise of the Humane AI Pin and updates on various gadgets.

title: Trump's Tariffs and Their Impact on Small Device Makers and Rare Earth Elements
summary:
- The U.S. depends on China for over 80% of its rare earth elements, essential for defense and tech industries.
- Trump established a 10% tariff on all Chinese imports, prompting retaliatory tariffs from China on U.S. goods.
- Demand for rare earth elements is expected to grow by 72% by 2030, while supply may not keep pace.
- Increasing geopolitical tensions lead nations to seek alternative rare earth sources outside China.
- ZapperBox raised its over-the-air DVR price by $300 due to the 10% tariff on goods from China.
- Founder Gopal Miglani mentioned manufacturing relocation to Taiwan has resulted in higher costs with reverse action being expensive.
- Smaller businesses face greater tariff impacts compared to larger companies like Apple and Amazon, which can easily absorb the costs.
- AstroPad is weighing price hikes and exploring Vietnam for manufacturing, citing quality and pricing benefits of Chinese production.

- Legal experts argue that the inquiry might misinterpret the First Amendment, which restricts government interference with speech, not private companies.
- President Trump signed an executive order making independent regulators accountable to the White House, potentially affecting the FTC's inquiry.
- The FTC launches an inquiry into content moderation practices of online platforms including Meta and Uber.
- The examination will assess if moderation amounts to "censorship."
