title: SG’s Union Fintech launches blockchain platform
summary:
- Union Fintech has launched a new blockchain platform.
- The platform aims to enhance financial services and improve transaction efficiency.
- This launch marks a significant step in the fintech development in Singapore.
- More details about the platform's features and capabilities were highlighted in the announcement.

sources.title: SG’s Union Fintech launches blockchain platform

title: Meta and X Settle Lawsuits with Donald Trump for a Total of $35 Million
summary:
- Meta has settled a lawsuit with Donald Trump for $25 million over the suspension of his accounts after the January 6 Capitol riot.
- $22 million of the settlement will fund Trump’s presidential library, rest covers legal fees and other plaintiffs.
- Zuckerberg’s decision to suspend Trump’s accounts was due to perceived risks during civil unrest; Trump has since been reinstated on Facebook and Instagram in 2023.
- Elon Musk’s X will pay Trump $10 million to settle a lawsuit related to his 2021 ban.
- Trump’s legal team considered dropping the lawsuit due to his growing relationship with Musk, who reinstated Trump’s account in 2022.
- CEOs of both platforms are facing scrutiny over their handling of Trump's accounts following the settlements.
- Trump's attorneys may pursue further settlements with Google as well.

sources.title: Meta agrees to pay Trump $25m for suspending accounts over Capitol riots
Meta settles lawsuit with Trump for $25m: sources
Elon Musk’s X will pay Trump $10M to settle lawsuit over 2021 ban
X to pay Donald Trump $10m to settle lawsuit over Capitol attack – report

title: Foxconn seeks partnership with Nissan rather than acquisition
summary:
- Foxconn aims to establish a cooperative relationship with [Nissan](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=nissan) rather than acquiring the company.
- Chairman Young Liu stated, 'Purchasing its shares is not our aim; our aim is cooperation.'
- Liu mentioned that acquiring a stake in Nissan could be considered if it facilitates collaboration.
- Foxconn isn't seeking to acquire Nissan but is open to collaboration and may consider a stake for partnership support.
- This is Foxconn's first public confirmation of talks with Nissan, which is looking for new partnerships after ending merger discussions with Honda.
- Foxconn is expanding into electric vehicles while focusing on design and manufacturing, not becoming a branded automaker.
- Following Liu's remarks, Nissan shares fell 6% and Foxconn shares dropped 1.1%.

sources.title: [Foxconn](https://pollinations.ai/referral?topic=foxconn) seeks Nissan partnership in EVs
Foxconn eyes collaboration over acquisition with Nissan

title: Trump nominates crypto-tied officials for key federal roles
summary:
- Former President Donald Trump has nominated several officials with ties to the cryptocurrency industry for significant federal positions.
- These nominations are part of his administration's push to establish a favorable regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies.
- The nominees include individuals with experience in blockchain technology and digital assets, signaling a potential shift in government approach towards cryptocurrencies.

sources.title: Trump nominates crypto-tied officials for key federal roles

title: Sony forecasts $8.7b profit driven by gaming
summary:
- Sony raised its full-year profit forecast by 2% to 1.34 trillion yen (US$8.7 billion), citing strong gaming performance.
- Third-quarter operating profit rose 1% to 469.3 billion yen (US$3 billion), driven by growth in games and music.
- Sony’s games unit profit jumped 37%, with PlayStation 5 sales rising to 9.5 million units, while music profits grew from higher streaming revenue.

sources.title: Sony forecasts $8.7b profit driven by gaming

title: Tencent wins in US copyright infringement
summary:
- Tencent won an US$85 million copyright infringement case against Unblock Tech on Feb. 7, 2025.
- The lawsuit involved Tencent subsidiaries accusing Unblock Tech of copying and distributing over 1,500 Tencent-owned shows.
- Tencent has a history of pursuing copyright lawsuits, including against ByteDance for unauthorized use of its content.

sources.title: Tencent wins in US copyright infringement

title: SailPoint's $1.38 Billion IPO Marks Significant Return to Public Markets
summary:
- SailPoint, a cybersecurity company, has launched an IPO with a valuation of $11.5 billion.
- The IPO involves selling 47.5 million shares at a price range of $19 to $21, aiming to raise $1 billion.
- Previously public, SailPoint was taken private by Thoma Bravo in 2022 for $6.9 billion.
- It reports $813 million in annual recurring revenue and $395 million in net losses as of January 2024.
- SailPoint intends to use IPO funds to address over $1 billion in debt and support operations.
- The IPO is crucial for tech startups and venture capitalists seeking market insights.
- SailPoint priced its IPO at $23 per share, ultimately raising $1.38 billion.
- The company sold 60 million shares, resulting in a $12.6 billion valuation.
- This marks SailPoint's return to the public market after more than two years since its privatization in 2022.
- Thoma Bravo acquired SailPoint in 2014 and took it public in 2017.

sources.title: Okta competitor SailPoint races toward $11.5B IPO
Cybersecurity firm SailPoint raises $1.38b in US IPO

title: Mamaearth parent Honasa reports $3m profit in Q3
summary:
- Honasa Consumer reports a consolidated net profit of 26.02 crore rupees (US$3 million) in Q3 FY25, a 0.4% increase from the previous year.
- Revenue rose 6% year-over-year to 517.51 crore rupees (US$59.6 million), with a 12% sequential increase.
- Volume growth was limited to 1.5% due to a shift in distribution strategy under "Project Neev," which increased Tier-I distributor share to 69% across 50 cities.

sources.title: Mamaearth parent Honasa reports $3m profit in Q3

title: Coinbase Plans to Re-Enter India Seeking Regulatory Approval
summary:
- Coinbase is planning to re-enter the Indian market after ceasing operations over a year ago.
- The company is engaging with the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) for necessary approvals to operate in India.
- Previous launch in 2022 was halted due to lack of recognition from India's National Payments Corporation.
- Coinbase aims to comply with regulatory requirements while exploring global expansion.
- The crypto market in India is small, impacted by tax regulations introduced in 2022.
- A potential re-entry could help fill the gap left by the collapse of the Indian exchange WazirX.
- CEO Brian Armstrong cited “informal pressure” from the Reserve Bank of India for the previous suspension.
- The Indian cryptocurrency market faces challenges such as a 30% tax on crypto income and a 1% transaction deduction.
- A Coinbase spokesperson confirmed intent to comply with regulations without sharing specifics on the FIU process.

sources.title: Coinbase eyes re-entry to India
Coinbase plans India return, seeks regulatory approval

title: Finmo and RasMal Secure Significant Funding for Expansion and Innovation
summary:
- Microsoft partners with Merak Capital to enhance Saudi Arabia’s gaming startup ecosystem.
- Startups will receive technology resources, mentoring, and access to international markets.
- Microsoft will provide Azure cloud services, game development tools, and industry expertise.
- The partnership includes the Exel Gaming Accelerator, focused on AI, cloud technology, and analytics.
- This initiative supports the existing US$80 million Gaming Fund and the goals of Saudi Vision 2030.
- Applications for the first cohort of the Exel Gaming Accelerator are open until Feb. 16, targeting startups with scalable business models.

* RasMal raised 18 million riyal (US$4.8 million) in a pre-series A round.
* The funding round was led by Syndicate Element Holding Group and announced at LEAP Riyadh 2025.
* RasMal specializes in cap table management and investment governance with AI-driven solutions.
* The investment will enhance automation in equity transfers and fundraising, supporting Saudi Vision 2030 goals.

- Finmo raised US$18.5 million in an oversubscribed series A funding round.
- Total funding for the company now stands at US$27 million.
- Funding was co-led by Quona Capital and PayPal Ventures with Citi Ventures participating.
- The investment will support product development, AI investment, and global operations scaling.
- Finmo's platform provides treasury management solutions including payment processing and cash flow visibility.

sources.title: Microsoft backs Saudi gaming startups with new program
Saudi fintech firm RasMal nets $4.8m pre-series A
SG fintech Finmo raises $18.5m to expand treasury platform

title: Trading platform eToro targets $5b valuation in US IPO
summary:
- Israeli trading platform eToro filed a confidential US IPO prospectus, aiming for a valuation above US$5 billion.
- This follows a failed 2021 SPAC merger targeting US$10 billion, later replaced by a US$250 million private funding round in 2023 at a US$3.5 billion valuation.
- eToro employs 1,700 people and expanded its portfolio with a US$55 million acquisition of Australia’s Spaceship in 2023.
- In September 2023, eToro settled with the SEC over unregistered broker allegations, paying a US$1.5 million fine without admitting wrongdoing.

sources.title: Trading platform eToro targets $5b valuation in US IPO

title: Elon Musk to Withdraw OpenAI Nonprofit Bid if Board Agrees to Terms
summary:
- Elon Musk offered to buy OpenAI’s governing nonprofit for $97.4 billion.
- OpenAI CEO Sam Altman humorously rejected the offer, referencing a previous Twitter acquisition.
- Musk's bid comes amid OpenAI's plans to convert to a for-profit structure, complicating their process.
- OpenAI's board may view Musk’s offer as a hostile takeover or question his funding.
- OpenAI’s counsel stated the nonprofit is not for sale and is valued at much more than Musk's bid.
- Musk’s ongoing lawsuits against OpenAI add tension to the situation.
- Elon Musk will withdraw his $97.4 billion bid for OpenAI’s nonprofit if the board agrees to halt its conversion to a for-profit corporation.
- Musk's filing to the U.S. District Court emphasizes that the offer is serious and insists on preserving the charity’s mission.
- OpenAI’s board quickly rejected Musk's bid as it does not value the nonprofit and asserts that it is not for sale.
- Musk has previously sued OpenAI, claiming anticompetitive behavior and fraud.

sources.title: This Week in AI: Musk bids for OpenAI
Elon Musk will withdraw bid for OpenAI’s nonprofit if its board agrees to terms

title: BuzzFeed plans new social platform to boost user connections
summary:
- BuzzFeed is launching a new social platform aimed at enhancing creativity and positive online interactions.
- CEO Jonah Peretti states the platform will take a user-centric approach rather than relying on fear-driven algorithms.
- The platform will include input from early testers but specifics on features remain undisclosed.
- This initiative seeks to offer an alternative to traditional social media by emphasizing self-expression.

sources.title: BuzzFeed plans new social platform to boost user connections

title: Baidu to offer AI chatbot free for all users starting April
summary:
- Baidu will make its AI chatbot, Ernie Bot, free for all users starting Apr. 1, citing advancements in technology and reduced operational costs.
- The chatbot will be accessible on desktop and mobile, with a new advanced search feature to enhance reasoning and tool integration.
- This decision comes as competition increases in China's AI market, with rivals like DeepSeek providing free chatbot services.
- In late 2023, Baidu launched premium Ernie 4.0 features priced at 59.9 yuan (US$8.18) per month, claiming performance on par with GPT-4.

sources.title: Baidu to offer AI chatbot free for all users starting April

title: Lyft stocks drops 7.9% after weak Q4 results
summary:
- Lyft’s stock fell 7.9% on Feb. 12 after reporting weak Q4 results and lower bookings guidance due to pricing cuts.
- Revenue reported at US$1.55 billion, slightly below the expected US$1.56 billion, with a 27% year-over-year increase.
- Bookings totaled US$4.28 billion, missing FactSet's US$4.32 billion estimate; expected next quarter bookings range lowered to US$4.05 billion - US$4.20 billion.
- Adjusted earnings per share were 29 cents, surpassing forecasts of 22 cents.
- Lyft reported 24.7 million active riders in Q4, exceeding expectations.

sources.title: Lyft stocks drops 7.9% after weak Q4 results

title: MyFitnessPal acquires meal-planning startup Intent
summary:
- MyFitnessPal has acquired meal-planning startup Intent in 2024.
- Intent's technology helps create personalized meal plans based on allergens, calorie goals, and dietary preferences.
- A new subscription plan, "Premium Plus," will be launched in late spring 2025 for $99.99 annually, with a waitlist opened.
- MyFitnessPal, which has 270 million users, aims to enhance meal planning with this acquisition, its first since being bought for $345 million in 2020.

sources.title: MyFitnessPal acquires meal-planning startup Intent

title: AI-powered legal platform SpotDraft raises $54m series B
summary:
- SpotDraft raised US$54 million in a Series B round, led by Vertex Growth and Trident Partners.
- Funds will be used for market expansion, hiring leadership, and enhancing AI-powered contract management.
- Founded in 2017, SpotDraft assists in redlining, e-signatures, and managing third-party contracts, serving clients like Spendlfo and Crunchbase.
- Previous funding rounds included US$26 million in Series A (2023) and US$1.5 million in 2019.
- SpotDraft operates in Bengaluru and New York.

sources.title: AI-powered legal platform SpotDraft raises $54m series B

title: Google Expands Image Remixing Tool Whisk and Tests AI for Age Verification
summary:
- Google has expanded its image remixing tool, Whisk, to over 100 countries as of February 11, 2025.
- Users can upload three images for remixing, utilizing the Imagen 3 model.
- Whisk is unavailable in countries like India, Indonesia, the EU, and the U.K.
- This expansion showcases Google's AI capabilities following its initial launch in the U.S.
- Similar tools like Apple's Image Playground exist for creative image mixing.

- Google plans to test AI technology for age verification, launching in the US this year.
- The AI will determine if users are over or under 18 to enhance age restrictions on platforms like YouTube.
- This initiative responds to increased pressure from lawmakers for improved online child safety.
- Future plans include expanding AI-based age verification internationally.
- Meta introduced similar age verification features in September 2024.

sources.title: Google Whisk, an image remixing tool, is now available in 100+ countries
Google to test AI for age verification, starting in US

title: Apple is reportedly exploring robotics, eyes 2028 launch
summary:
- Apple is investigating both humanoid and non-humanoid robotic designs according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo.
- The research is in the early proof-of-concept stage, with a potentially optimistic timeline for mass production in 2028.
- Focus is on user interaction, sensing hardware, and software, with speculation about integration into a future smart home ecosystem.
- The company faces challenges similar to those experienced with the Apple Car project, including hiring constraints and production scaling issues.

sources.title: Apple is reportedly exploring robotics, eyes 2028 launch

title: Adobe launches new AI video tool
summary:
- Adobe launched a new AI video generation tool priced at US$0.50 per five-second video.
- Subscription plans are available at US$9.99 and US$29.99 per month.
- The tool can create videos, photos, illustrations, and audio, offering limited free access for Adobe Creative Cloud subscribers.
- This launch positions Adobe against competitors like OpenAI and Runway.
- Adobe integrates its Firefly AI model emphasizing user control and copyright safety, with Firefly logging 18 billion uses.
- The tool currently supports HD resolution with plans for additional resolution options.

sources.title: Adobe launches new AI video tool

title: Apple TV App and Streaming Services Launch on Android Devices
summary:
- Apple TV app, including Apple TV+ and MLS Season Pass, launched on Android devices.
- Supports phones, tablets, and foldables, expanding beyond the previous Google TV version.
- Users can create an Apple account directly on their device, subscription priced at $9.99/month.
- Service launches in markets where Android is prevalent, increasing user reach.
- Features popular Apple Original shows and films, and includes offline downloads and watchlists.
- MLS Season Pass available as an add-on for $12.99/month or $79/season.
- Android app optimized using Material Design; lacks in-app Store found in Apple version.
- Rollout began on February 12, 2025, coinciding with Apple TV+'s five-year mark in the streaming arena.
- Announcement expected as early as February 13.
- This marks the first time Apple TV+ will be accessible on Android devices, previously available only on Apple operating systems and select third-party platforms like Roku.
- Apple typically restricts services to its ecosystem, with few exceptions like the Music app for Android.

sources.title: Apple’s TV app, TV+ streaming service, and MLS Season Pass launches on Android
Apple TV app now available on Android

title: CATL expands into robotics
summary:
- CATL is expanding into robotics and advanced technologies in response to slower battery business growth. 
- A new team in Shanghai will develop industrial robots, including robotic arms and AGVs, for CATL's battery plants. 
- The company is also exploring humanoid robotics and engaging with manufacturers for potential investments. 
- In addition to robotics, CATL is researching room-temperature superconductors and nuclear fusion, indicating a broader strategy in advanced technology.

sources.title: CATL expands into robotics

title: Reddit shares drop 15% as user growth slows
summary:
- Reddit Inc. reported a 15% decline in shares due to weaker-than-expected user growth in Q4.
- The platform averaged 101.7 million daily active users, less than the expected 103.8 million.
- The decline in user growth was linked to changes in Google's search algorithm affecting traffic.
- Google accounts for up to 50% of Reddit's daily traffic, highlighting the importance of search visibility.
- Despite user growth miss, Reddit’s holiday quarter sales surged 71% to $427.7 million, exceeding the $405 million analyst estimates.

sources.title: Reddit shares drop 15% as user growth slows

title: Getaround abruptly shuts down US car-sharing operations
summary:
- Getaround is ceasing U.S. operations after previously cutting 30% of its North American workforce.
- The company is shifting focus to its European business where it operates in six countries.
- Customers were urged to return rentals to avoid liability issues, with coverage ending if vehicles are not returned.
- Getaround will incur charges of $1.5 million to $2 million due to the layoffs, with most U.S. employees ending their employment by February 14, 2025.

sources.title: Getaround abruptly shuts down US car-sharing operations

title: Roblox adds Arabic support as MENA user base grows
summary:
- Roblox introduces Arabic language support on desktop, mobile, PlayStation, and Xbox platforms.
- Announcement made by CEO David Baszucki at the World Government Summit in Dubai.
- Arabic is the 16th language on Roblox, reflecting growth in the MENA region, with 80% increase in daily active users from Q3 2021 to Q3 2024.
- Engagement hours rose by 76% in five MENA countries, including the UAE and Saudi Arabia.
- New features include text chat filtering, moderation, automatic translation tools, and parental controls in Arabic.
- A study shows Roblox's economic contributions to MENA's GDP grew by 55% year-over-year in 2024.

sources.title: Roblox adds Arabic support as MENA user base grows

title: OpenAI Cancels o3 Model to Focus on GPT-5 Launch
summary:
- OpenAI cancels the o3 AI model, originally set for early 2025, to integrate technologies into GPT-5.
- CEO Sam Altman highlights the goal of simplifying product offerings for better user experience.
- GPT-4.5, also called Orion, is expected to be the last model before GPT-5, with no specific release date announced.
- The “o3” and “o3 mini” were introduced in December 2024, but will now be consolidated into the GPT series.

sources.title: OpenAI cancels its o3 AI model in favor of a ‘unified’ next-gen release
OpenAI to discontinue o3 model for GPT-5 launch

title: US game engine giant Unity cuts jobs, scales back in Israel
summary:
- Unity Technologies is undergoing layoffs as part of restructuring efforts.
- Specific number of job cuts not disclosed, but entire departments were affected, particularly in Israel.
- Nadav Ashkenazy, Chief Revenue Officer of Unity’s Tel Aviv office, will be leaving in the coming months.
- Layoffs mark a shift in Unity’s ad division with responsibilities moving to North America.
- CEO Matthew Bromberg emphasized the need for efficiency and integration of ironSource’s LevelPlay into Unity’s operations.
- Prior strategies were acknowledged to have faced challenges and did not meet expectations.
- The revenue organization is now being restructured into two global teams with minimal ties to the Tel Aviv office.

sources.title: US game engine giant Unity cuts jobs, scales back in Israel

title: Indian cloud storage startup Lucidity nets $21m series A
summary:
- Indian startup Lucidity has raised $21 million in Series A funding led by WestBridge Capital to help enterprises optimize cloud storage.
- The company’s software automates storage optimization, potentially reducing cloud costs by up to 70%.
- Lucidity's products include Storage Auto-Scaler, which dynamically adjusts storage based on demand, and Storage Audit, a free tool for evaluating cloud storage usage.
- The funding will be used to expand its marketing team and enhance enterprise storage management solutions.
- Founded in 2021, Lucidity offers AI-powered software for effective cloud storage management, automating provisioning and ensuring compatibility with AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.

sources.title: Lucidity snags $21M to help enterprises optimize their cloud storage
Indian cloud storage startup Lucidity nets $21m series A

title: Saudi logistics startup Pieship raises $2.1m seed funding
summary:
- Pieship has raised $2.1 million in seed funding led by Nama Ventures, with participation from Seedra Ventures and angel investors.
- The funding follows a pre-seed investment completed in 2024.
- Founded in late 2023, Pieship utilizes AI for shipment analysis and route optimization.
- Plans to expand operations to major Saudi cities include Jeddah, Makkah, Madinah, Dammam, Al Khobar, Qassim, and Khamis Mushait.
- Aiming to grow its registered driver network to 5,000 for improved delivery efficiency.

sources.title: Saudi logistics startup Pieship raises $2.1m seed funding
